arguments.summary: If not null, assume that the input file has this order even if the header says otherwise.
arguments.name: --ASSUME_SORT_ORDER

arguments.summary: If true, assume that the input file is coordinate sorted even if the header says otherwise. Deprecated, used ASSUME_SORT_ORDER=coordinate instead.
arguments.name: --ASSUME_SORTED

arguments.summary: Barcode SAM tag (ex. BC for 10X Genomics)
arguments.name: --BARCODE_TAG

arguments.summary: Comment(s) to include in the output file's header.
arguments.name: --COMMENT

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and GELI).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: The scoring strategy for choosing the non-duplicate among candidates.
arguments.name: --DUPLICATE_SCORING_STRATEGY

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: One or more input SAM or BAM files to analyze. Must be coordinate sorted.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: Maximum number of file handles to keep open when spilling read ends to disk. Set this number a little lower than the per-process maximum number of file that may be open. This number can be found by executing the 'ulimit -n' command on a Unix system.
arguments.name: --MAX_FILE_HANDLES_FOR_READ_ENDS_MAP

arguments.summary: This number is the maximum size of a set of duplicate reads for which we will attempt to determine which are optical duplicates.  Please be aware that if you raise this value too high and do encounter a very large set of duplicate reads, it will severely affect the runtime of this tool.  To completely disable this check, set the value to -1.
arguments.name: --MAX_OPTICAL_DUPLICATE_SET_SIZE

arguments.summary: When writing SAM files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort a SAM file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: This option is obsolete. ReadEnds will always be spilled to disk.
arguments.name: --MAX_SEQUENCES_FOR_DISK_READ_ENDS_MAP
arguments.fulltext:
If more than this many sequences in SAM file, don't spill to disk because there will not
 be enough file handles.

arguments.summary: File to write duplication metrics to
arguments.name: --METRICS_FILE

arguments.summary: The maximum offset between two duplicate clusters in order to consider them optical duplicates. The default is appropriate for unpatterned versions of the Illumina platform. For the patterned flowcell models, 2500 is moreappropriate. For other platforms and models, users should experiment to find what works best.
arguments.name: --OPTICAL_DUPLICATE_PIXEL_DISTANCE

arguments.summary: The output file to write marked records to
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Value of CL tag of PG record to be created. If not supplied the command line will be detected automatically.
arguments.name: --PROGRAM_GROUP_COMMAND_LINE

arguments.summary: Value of PN tag of PG record to be created.
arguments.name: --PROGRAM_GROUP_NAME

arguments.summary: Value of VN tag of PG record to be created. If not specified, the version will be detected automatically.
arguments.name: --PROGRAM_GROUP_VERSION

arguments.summary: The program record ID for the @PG record(s) created by this program. Set to null to disable PG record creation.  This string may have a suffix appended to avoid collision with other program record IDs.
arguments.name: --PROGRAM_RECORD_ID

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Regular expression that can be used to parse read names in the incoming SAM file. Read names are parsed to extract three variables: tile/region, x coordinate and y coordinate. These values are used to estimate the rate of optical duplication in order to give a more accurate estimated library size. Set this option to null to disable optical duplicate detection, e.g. for RNA-seq or other data where duplicate sets are extremely large and estimating library complexity is not an aim. Note that without optical duplicate counts, library size estimation will be inaccurate. The regular expression should contain three capture groups for the three variables, in order. It must match the entire read name. Note that if the default regex is specified, a regex match is not actually done, but instead the read name  is split on colon character. For 5 element names, the 3rd, 4th and 5th elements are assumed to be tile, x and y values. For 7 element names (CASAVA 1.8), the 5th, 6th, and 7th elements are assumed to be tile, x and y values.
arguments.name: --READ_NAME_REGEX
arguments.defaultValue: <optimized capture of last three ':' separated fields as numeric values>

arguments.summary: Read one barcode SAM tag (ex. BX for 10X Genomics)
arguments.name: --READ_ONE_BARCODE_TAG

arguments.summary: Read two barcode SAM tag (ex. BX for 10X Genomics)
arguments.name: --READ_TWO_BARCODE_TAG

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: If true do not write duplicates to the output file instead of writing them with appropriate flags set.
arguments.name: --REMOVE_DUPLICATES

arguments.summary: If true remove 'optical' duplicates and other duplicates that appear to have arisen from the sequencing process instead of the library preparation process, even if REMOVE_DUPLICATES is false. If REMOVE_DUPLICATES is true, all duplicates are removed and this option is ignored.
arguments.name: --REMOVE_SEQUENCING_DUPLICATES

arguments.summary: This number, plus the maximum RAM available to the JVM, determine the memory footprint used by some of the sorting collections.  If you are running out of memory, try reducing this number.
arguments.name: --SORTING_COLLECTION_SIZE_RATIO

arguments.summary: If a read appears in a duplicate set, add two tags. The first tag, DUPLICATE_SET_SIZE_TAG (DS), indicates the size of the duplicate set. The smallest possible DS value is 2 which occurs when two reads map to the same portion of the reference only one of which is marked as duplicate. The second tag, DUPLICATE_SET_INDEX_TAG (DI), represents a unique identifier for the duplicate set to which the record belongs. This identifier is the index-in-file of the representative read that was selected out of the duplicate set.
arguments.name: --TAG_DUPLICATE_SET_MEMBERS

arguments.summary: Determines how duplicate types are recorded in the DT optional attribute.
arguments.name: --TAGGING_POLICY

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

description:
A better duplication marking algorithm that handles all cases including clipped
 and gapped alignments.
name: MarkDuplicates
